data.title: AI is reshaping crypto for the next bull run, focusing on trust & regulation. AI detects fraud, manages risk, and aids adoption. AI reduces operational complexity, accelerating adoption as a financial service. Regulators can enforce compliance effectively at scale.
data.description: The article discusses how the traditional cycles of the crypto market may be shifting, with artificial intelligence (AI) playing a key role in reshaping trust, regulation, and market risk. AI is being increasingly used as an infrastructure layer in the crypto industry to monitor activity, control automated decisions, and enhance user safety in transactions. This adoption of AI is seen as crucial in reducing operational risks such as fraud and protocol exploits. Platforms like Aurum are prioritizing AI-driven controls to enhance trust and facilitate advanced automation. The CEO of Aurum emphasized the importance of trust in driving growth and highlighted the role of AI in fraud detection, compliance, and risk management. The article also mentions how AI can help in reducing friction in crypto transactions, leading to increased adoption by institutions and retail investors. Furthermore, AI is transforming regulatory oversight, making it continuous and proactive rather than reactive. Overall, the integration of AI in the crypto industry could potentially lead to significant changes in how the market operates.

data.title: Deep Fission to hold public meeting in Parsons, Kansas on March 12 from 5-7pm CT to discuss advanced nuclear energy.
data.description: Deep Fission, Inc., an innovative nuclear energy company, will hold a public meeting in Parsons, Kansas on Thursday, March 12, from 5:00–7:00 p.m. CT. The event will be at the Wall Event Center, 2605 Main St., Parsons, KS 67357. Deep Fission aims to install small modular pressurized water reactors one mile underground. Community members are welcome to attend the meeting to gain insights into the project, raise queries, and engage with company representatives.

data.title: New guide released for GitHub Copilot CLI as it becomes generally available for paid subscribers in Feb 2026.
data.description: In February 2026, GitHub made available a practical guide for the Copilot CLI, the AI coding assistant, upon its general availability to all paid subscribers. This guide aims to assist users in effectively utilizing the Copilot CLI tool.

data.title: Inventor from Vallejo creates GREEN HAVEN bathroom product for dogs to feel comfortable; released on Feb. 27, 2026.
data.description: An inventor from Vallejo, California, shared their motivation behind creating a new bathroom solution for dogs in Pittsburgh on February 27, 2026. Their innovation, known as the GREEN HAVEN, is crafted to provide a welcoming environment for dogs during their bathroom breaks. This product aims to offer dogs a comfortable space, resembling a haven, while attending to their needs.

data.title: Stock market down for week, major indexes below 50-day lines. Nvidia tumbles despite strong earnings.
data.description: During the week, the stock market experienced a decline, with all major indexes falling below their 50-day moving averages. Despite posting strong earnings, Nvidia saw a significant drop in its stock price. The overall market sentiment was negative due to concerns regarding artificial intelligence. This resulted in a challenging week for investors, with the stock market unable to sustain key levels. Overall, it was a difficult week with notable declines in major indexes and specific stocks like Nvidia.

data.title: CoreWeave Q4 revenue beats at $1.6B with 110% YoY growth. Analysts update rating & price targets. Expects 140% growth in 2026.
data.description: Shares of CoreWeave Inc (CRWV) plummeted in early trading today following the announcement of fourth-quarter results, which were received with mixed reactions. According to analysts, DA Davidson's Alexander Platt maintained a Buy rating and increased the price target to $125 from $110. Meanwhile, Cantor Fitzgerald's Thomas Blakey affirmed an Overweight rating with a price target of $131. On the other hand, Needham's Mike Cikos stuck with a Hold rating. CoreWeave disclosed total revenue of $1.6 billion for the quarter, marking a remarkable 110% year-on-year growth, as highlighted by Platt. The company's revenue backlog expanded to $66.8 billion, primarily due to the addition of a new contract from Meta Platforms Inc (META) worth approximately $5 billion. CoreWeave also delivered robust earnings performance during this period, fueled by sustained... (The full story is accessible on Benzinga.com.)

data.title: Dow Jones down 700 points due to inflation data, CoreWeave plunges.
data.description: Today, the Dow Jones index experienced a significant drop of 700 points following the release of unexpected inflation data. Additionally, CoreWeave, a partner of Nvidia, witnessed a plunge in its stocks after reporting earnings. This event highlights the volatile nature of the stock market in response to economic indicators. Investors are closely monitoring these developments as they navigate through the current market conditions.

data.title: A. Sundas introduces Algoritmo Soccer, software for youth football analysis with Key Performance Indicators. #sports #technology #innovation
data.description: In Miami on February 27, 2026, Alessio Sundas, the sports agent and director of AGSM Group, introduced Algoritmo Soccer, a sophisticated software platform designed for evaluating and tracking Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of aspiring soccer players. This innovative tool is set to revolutionize player analysis at the youth level, providing a comprehensive solution for monitoring performance metrics essential for player development and scouting.

data.title: Global Battery Backup Unit (BBU) market valued at USD 8.02 Billion in 2024; expected to reach USD 16.6 Billion by 2031 with 11.0% CAGR.
data.description: In Bangalore, India, as of February 27, 2026, the market size of Battery Backup Units (BBU) was recorded at USD 8,021 million in 2024. It is expected to grow to USD 16,634 million by 2031, reflecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of...

data.title: EU's crypto tax rules to mandate platforms reporting user data and transactions by 2026, enhancing tax transparency for digital assets.
data.description: Starting in 2026, the European Union will implement new tax regulations for cryptocurrencies. These rules will mandate that platforms report user information and transaction details, aiming to enhance tax transparency for digital assets.

data.title: SpaceX CRS-33 brought back over 55 ISS National Lab-sponsored payloads, advancing medicine, tech, and workforce development.
data.description: Over 55 projects have successfully returned to Earth from the space station via SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft. The splashdown occurred off the coast of Southern California on February 27, 2026. These projects aim to progress medicine, technology, and workforce development.

data.title: Tamarack Resort offers 26/27 All Season Pass starting at $499 for adults and $999 for families, lowest price of the year.
data.description: In Tamarack, Idaho, the Tamarack Resort recently introduced its 26/27 All Season Pass, providing Idaho families and outdoor lovers with the most affordable pass price of the year. As of today, Adult All Season Passes can be purchased for $499, presenting a substantial discount from previous prices. This initiative aims to encourage individuals to engage in year-round outdoor activities at the resort.

data.title: EQT sells final stake in Azelis Group, a chemical and food ingredient provider. Azelis sees growth in sales and profits under EQT.
data.description: EQT has successfully concluded the last stage of selling its stake in Azelis Group NV, a prominent global innovation service provider specializing in the specialty chemicals and food ingredients sector. During EQT's ownership, Azelis experienced substantial growth in revenue and EBITA, achieving noteworthy increases through organic expansion and strategic bolt-on M&A activity.

data.title: Podcast episode on presidential vehicles with WHHA President McLaurin and retired Secret Service Agent Bush. Released Feb 27, 2026.
data.description: Stewart McLaurin, the President of the White House Historical Association, recently engaged in a discussion with retired U.S. Secret Service Agent John Bush regarding famous presidential vehicles. In a new episode of The White House 1600 series, the Association shared insights into the history of these iconic vehicles. The discussion took place in Washington on February 27, 2026.

data.title: U.S. Economy Showing Signs of Reacceleration with ISM Manufacturing Index at a 4-year high, indicating a shift in supply-demand dynamics.
data.description: The ISM manufacturing index indicates a potential reacceleration in U.S. manufacturing, with the new orders component reaching its highest level in nearly four years. Retailers are facing low inventory levels relative to sales, as demand has outpaced restocking abilities. Import volumes have not significantly increased due to a weaker dollar, leading to greater reliance on domestic production. This shift in supply-demand dynamics aligns with the positive trends in the ISM data, suggesting a substantial rebound in the manufacturing sector. The complete story can be found on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Laverne Cox & Amber Riley join ETAF ahead of Feb. 28 HIV Is Not a Crime Awareness Day to modernize outdated HIV laws.
data.description: Recently crowned champions Cox and Riley are set to spearhead a nation-wide effort to reform antiquated HIV laws. On February 27, 2026, the Elizabeth Taylor AIDS Foundation (ETAF) marked the annual HIV IS NOT A CRIME Awareness Day. This event serves as a key element in the widespread initiative to update laws related to HIV.
